title: Headline font for Port magazine
content:
Hi, another bold condensed upper case enquiry. Many thanks

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235850/http:/typophile.com/files/image_25.jpg) | 1.79 MB |
author: RBM

comments.content: The closest I have, matching almost all specifications we have with this sample (main difference is /C finials), is [Glenlake](http://web.archive.org/web/20141230235850/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/filmotype/glenlake).

Hi Ryuk,

Pretty close isn't it?! You're right though, C and S terminals are indeed longer on my sample than Glenlake. And the N is substantially different.

Thanks very much for your help. I will keep on hunting…

Hey thanks akira - interesting to see it's by Matt Willey. Seems to be the man in editorial type design.

Best  
Richard
